definition: the placement of one thing on top of another
details:
noun
- the placement of one thing on top of another
- (geometry) the placement of one object ideally in the position of another one in order to show that the two coincide
- the geologic principle that in a series of stratified sedimentary rocks the lowest stratum is the oldest
= example: the geologic principle that in a series of stratified sedimentary rocks the lowest stratum is the oldest
= synonyms: principle of superposition, superposition principle
- (geology) the deposition of one geological stratum on another
